channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping garden waster, 29th June
item.description:
Someone has driven up outside our house whilst we were away and left a very large bag if garden waste outside the property. This isn't the first time this has happened - we've had tryes and even a fridge dumped outside our house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noose attached to tree, 29th June
item.description:
Some poor person hanged themselves a few months ago in the small wooded area in avery hill park by the unused university building off reinickendorf ave park entrance. The noose the person used is still attached to the tree, a blue ratchet strap. Could somebody please remove this out of respect for the person, their family and friends. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Reinickendorf Avenue, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 29th June
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked on Maberley Rd opposite my flat (22d) since the beginning of January 2025, so almost 6 months. It has not moved at all and is very dusty. Road tax and MOT are both valid, but it seems odd that it hasn't moved for 6 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Very dangerous number 18 Emberton190 Albany road se5 left garden waste wooden broken fence...a broken garden shed next to a child's swing. It's. Very dangerous and a eye saw. The whole.estate watched them dump It there with no care in the world

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Way, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle on Elmers End Rd, 29th June
item.description:
A car looks abandoned on Elmers End Road, pretty much opposite the turning into Ancaster Rd. The left front and rear tyres are punctured and the car has not moved in a few months. It's MOT has also expired, but the road tax is still valid.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
